column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=custom.Span|label
#T_RL=custom.Relation|label|BT_custom.Span
#Text=Firste, put them into a Pot with sweete
#Text= broth, and set them on the fire, then take
#Text= a Carret roote, and cut him in peeces, and
#Text= put into the potte, then take perselye with
#Text= sweete hearbes, and chop them a little, and
#Text= put them into the potte, then take Syna-
#Text= mon, Ginger, Nutmegges, and Pepper,
#Text= and put in a little Vergice, and so season it
#Text= with salt, serue them vpon soppes, and gar-
#Text= nish them with fruit.
#Text=To make stewed Steakes.
#Text=Take a peece of Mutton, and cutte it in
#Text= peeces, and washe it very cleane, and
#Text= put it into a faire potte with Ale, or
#Text= with halfe Wine, then make it boyle, and
#Text= skumme it cleyne, and put into your pot a
#Text= faggot of Rosemary and Time, then take
#Text= some Parsely picked fine, and some onyons
#Text= cut round, and let them all boyle together,
#Text=then take prunes, & raisons, dates, and cur-
#Text= rans and let it boyle altogether, and season
#Text= it with Sinamon and Ginger Nutmeggs,
#Text= two or three Cloues, and Salt, and so serue
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= [f9r]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= it on soppes, and garnish it with fruite.
#Text=To stewe Calues feete.
#Text=Take calues feet faire blanches and cut
#Text= them in the half, & when they be more
#Text= then halfe boyled, put to them great
#Text= raisons, mutton broth, a little saffron, and
#Text= sweete butter, pepper, suger, and some sweet
#Text= hearbes finelye minced, boyle calues feete,
#Text= sheepes feete, or lambes feete with Mutton
#Text= broth, sweete hearbes and Onyons chopped
#Text=
#Text= [f9v]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= To make Aloes.
#Text=Take a legge of veale or mutton, and slice
#Text= it in thin slices, and lay them in a plat-
#Text= ter, and cast on salte, and put thereon the
#Text= yolkes of tenne Egges, and a great sorte of
#Text= small raisons and dates finely minced, then
#Text= take vineger, and a little saffron, cloues and
#Text= mace, and a little Pepper, and mingle it to-
#Text= gether, and poure it all about it, and then al
#Text= to worke it together, and when it is tho-
#Text= rowly seasoned, put it on a spit, and set plat-
#Text= ters vnderneath it, and baste it with butter,
#Text= and then make a sauce with Vinegerm and
#Text= ginger, and suger, and lay the aloes vpon it
#Text= and so serue it in.
#Text=To make Fritters of Spinnedge.
#Text=Take a good deale of Spinnedge, and
#Text= washe it cleane, then boyle it in faire wa-
#Text= ter, and when it is boyled, then take it forth
#Text= and let the water runne from it, then chop
#Text= it with the backe of a knife, and then put in
#Text= some egges and grated Bread, and season
#Text= it with suger, sinamon, ginger, and pepper,
#Text= dates minced fine, and currans, and rowle
#Text= them like a ball, and dippe them in Butter
#Text= made of Ale and flower.
#Text=A Fritter to be made in a
#Text= Moulde.
#Text=[f10r]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= Take Oxe white and mince it fine, then
#Text=take Dates and mince them fine, then
#Text= take Currans, Egges, white grated bread
#Text= and season it with suger, sinaman, and gin-
#Text= ger, cloues, mace and saffron, and stirre it
#Text= well together, then driue a thicke Cake of
#Text= paste, and lay in the moulde, and fill it with
#Text= the stuffe, and lay another cake of past vpon
#Text= it, then iogge it about, and so fry it.
#Text=To boyle Pigeons in blacke
#Text= broath.
#Text=First roste them a little, then put them in-
#Text= to an earthen pot, with a little quantitye
#Text= of sweete Broth, then take Onyons, and
#Text= slice them, and set them on the Coles with
#Text= some butter to take away the sent of them,
#Text= put them into the Pigeons, and leyre it
#Text= with a toste of bread, drawne with Vine-
#Text= ger, then put some sweete hearbes halfe
#Text= cut, and synamon and Ginger, and grosse
#Text=Pepper, and let them boyle, and season
#Text= them with salte, serue them vpon soppes,
#Text= and garnish them with fruit.
#Text=To smere a Conie.
#Text=Take the Liuers and boyle them, and
#Text= choppe it, and sweet hearbs, apples, and
#Text= the yolkes of hard egges, and choppe them
#Text= altogether, and currans, suger, synamon,
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= [f10v]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= ginger and perselye, and fill the Conny full
#Text= hereof, then put her into the sweete broth,
#Text= and put in sweete Butter, then choppe the
#Text= yolks of hard egges, synamon, ginger, Su-
#Text= ger, and cast it on the Cony when you serue
#Text= it vp, season it with salte, serue it on soppes,
#Text=and garnsh it with fruit.
#Text=To boyle a Mallard with
#Text= Cabbadge.
#Text=Take some cabbadge, and prick and wash
#Text= them cleane, and perboyle them in faire
#Text= water, then put them into a Collender, and
#Text= let the water runne from them cleane, then
#Text= put them into a faire Earthen Pot, and as
#Text= much sweete Broth as will couer the cab-
#Text= badge, and sweete Butter, then take yonr
#Text= Mallard and roste it halfe enough, and saue
#Text= the dripping of him, then cut him in the
#Text= side, and put the mallard into the cabbedge,
#Text= and put into it all your dripping, then let it
#Text= stew an houre, and season it with salte, and
#Text= serue it vppon soppes.
#Text=To boyle a Ducke with
#Text= Turneps.
#Text=Take her first, and put her into a potte
#Text= with stewed broth, then take perselye,
#Text= and sweete hearbes, and chop them, and per-
#Text= boyle the rootes very well in an other pot,
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= [f10r]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= then put vnto them sweet butter, Cyna-
#Text= mon, Gynger, grosse Pepper and whole
#Text= Mace, and so season it with salt, and serue it
#Text= vpon soppes.
#Text=To make white Estings.
#Text=Take great Otemeale, and lay in milke
#Text= to steepe, then put in the yolkes of some
#Text= Egges, and take Oxe whyte and mince it
#Text= small, then season it with suger, cynamon,
#Text= ginger, cloues, mace, and saffron, and salt,
#Text=and so fill them.
#Text=To make blacke puddings.
#Text=Take great otmeale and lay it in milke
#Text= to steepe, then take sheepes bloud and
#Text= put to it, and take Oxe white and mince
#Text= into it, then take a fewe sweet hearbes and
#Text= two or three leeke blades, and choppe them
#Text= very small, and then put into it the yolkes
#Text= of some egges, and season it with Cyna-
#Text= mon, ginger, cloues, Mace, pepper and salt,
#Text= and so fill them.
#Text=To make strong broth for
#Text= sicke men.
#Text=Take a pound of almonds and blanche
#Text= them, and beat them in a morter very
#Text= fine, then take the braines of a capon
#Text= and beat with it, then put into it a litle cream,
#Text= nd make it to drawe through a strayner,
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= [f10v]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= then set it on the fire in a dish, and season it
#Text= with rose water and suger, and stirre it.
#Text=To boile a Breame.
#Text=Take White wine and put it into a pot,
#Text= and let it seeth, then take your breame
#Text= and cut hym in the midst, and put him in,
#Text= then take an Onion and chop it small, then
#Text= take nutmegs beaten, cinamon and gin-
#Text= ger, whole mace, and a pound of butter,
#Text= and let it boile altogether, and so season it
#Text= with salt, serue it vppon soppes, and garnish
#Text= it with fruit.
#Text=To boile Muskles.
#Text=to boile on the other side, take it off, and put
#Text= it into a Colender, and let the water runne
#Text= out from it, but put in salt in the boyling of
#Text= it, then take a little faire water and sweete
#Text= butter, and let it boyle in a dish vntill it bee
#Text= something thick, then powre it on the stock-
#Text= fish and serue it.
#Text=To make bake meates.
#Text=Take a legge of Lambe, and cut out all
#Text= the fleshe, and saue the skynne whole,
#Text= then mince it fine and white with it, then
#Text= oyt in grated bread, and some egges white
#Text= and all, and some Dates and Currantes,
#Text= then season it with some Pepper, Cyna-
#Text= mon Ginger, and some Nutmegges and
#Text= Carrawaies, and a little creame, and tem-
#Text= per it altogether, then put it into the legge
#Text= of the Lambe againe, and let it bake a little
#Text=before you put it into your Pye, and when
#Text= you haue put it into your Pye, then put in
#Text= a little of the Pudding about it, and when
#Text= it is almost baked, then put in veriuce, suger
#Text= and sweet butter, and so serue it.
#Text=Another bake meate.
#Text=Take a leg of veale, and cut it in slices,
#Text= and beate it with the back of a knife,
#Text= then take time, margerum and peni-
#Text= riall, sauerie, and perselye, and one Oni-
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= [f11v]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= on, and chop them altogether verie small,
#Text= then breake in some egges whites and all,
#Text= and put in your hearbes and season it with
#Text= pepper, nutmegs and salt, and a litle suger,
#Text=then stirre them altogether, and then lap
#Text= them vp like allowes, and cast a fewe cur-
#Text= rants and dates, and butter amongst them.
#Text=Another bake meate.
#Text=Tahe two pounde of White and a little
#Text= veale, and mince it together, then take
#Text= a little peniriall, sauerie and margerum,
#Text= and vnset Leekes, and chop them fine, and
#Text= put in some egges and some creame, then
#Text= stirre it all well together, and season it with
#Text= pepper, nutmegs and salt, then put it into
#Text= the pye, and cut the lid, and let it bake till it
#Text= be drye, then serue it.
#Text=To make Marie pies.
#Text=Make fine past, and put in the white of
#Text= one egge and suger, and when they
#Text= are made in little coffins set them into the
#Text= Ouen vpon a paper a litle while then take
#Text=then out and put in marie, and then close
#Text= them vp and pricke them, and set them in a-
#Text= gain, and when they are broken serue them
#Text= with blanch pouder strowed vpon them.
#Text=[f12r]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= To boile pie meate.
#Text=Take a legge of mutton, and mince it very
#Text= fine with sewet and seeth it in a litle pan
#Text= or an earthen pot with butter, and season it
#Text= with cloues, mace, great raysons, and
#Text= prunes, and salt, and serue it in a dish, and
#Text= if you will, put in some iuyce of Orenges
#Text= and lay halfe an orenge vpon it.
#Text=To make fine Cakes.
#Text=Take fine flowre and good Samaske wa-
#Text=them into the colde water, then season them
#Text= with salt and ginger, laye them into the past
#Text= and vpon them lay leached, larde close them
#Text= and bake them.
#Text=To bake a brest of veale.
#Text=Take and breake the bones thereof in
#Text= the middest and perboyle hym and
#Text= take out the bones, and season him
#Text= with pepper and salt, and lay him in the
#Text= coffin with a little sweete butter, and close
#Text= him vp then make a caudell of the yolkes of
#Text= an egge and straine it, and boyle it in a
#Text= chafing dish of coales and season it with su-
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= [f13r]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= ger, and put it in the pie and set it into the o-
#Text=uen againe.
#Text=To make a pudding in a breast of
#Text= veale.
#Text=Take perselye, Time, washe them,
#Text= pricke them, and choppe them small,
#Text= then take viii. yolkes of egges, grated bread,
#Text= and halfe a pinte of creame beeing verie
#Text= sweete, then season it with pepper, Cloues,
#Text= and Mace, Saffron and Suger small Ray-
#Text= sons and salt, put it in and roste it and serue
#Text= it.
#Text=To bake a Gammon of Bacon.
#Text=Take a Gammon of Bacon, water it sixe
#Text= dayes and perboyle him halfe enough
#Text= and laye him in presse then take the sworde
#Text= of hum and stuffe him with cloues, and sea-
#Text= son him with pepper, and saffron.
#Text=And close
#Text= vp in a standing pye, bake him and so serue
#Text=moulds with butter before you put it your
#Text= stuffe, and when you will occupie of it, slice
#Text= it thinne and drie it in the ouen, your ouen
#Text= beeing no whotter then you may abide your
#Text= hand in the bottome.
#Text=To baje a Turkie and take out
#Text= his bones.
#Text=Take a fat Turkie, and after you haue
#Text= scalded him and washed him cleane, lay
#Text= him vpon a faire cloth and slit him through-
#Text= out the backe, and when you haue taken
#Text= out his garbage, then you must take out
#Text= his bones so bare as you can, when you
#Text= haue so doone wash him cleane, then trusse
#Text= him and pricke his backe toghether, and so
#Text= haue a faire kettle of seething water and
#Text= perboyle him a little, then take him vp that
#Text= the water may runne cleane out from him,
#Text= and when he is colde, season him with pep-
#Text=per and Salt, and then pricke hym with a
#Text= fewe cloues in the breast, and also drawe
#Text= him with larde if you like of it, and when
#Text= you haue maide your coffin and laide your
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= [f14r]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= Turkie in it, then you must put some But-
#Text= ter in it, and so close him vp. in this sorte you
#Text= may bake a goose, a Pheasant, or capon.
#Text=To bake a Kidde.
#Text=Take your Kid and perboule him, and
#Text= wash it in vergice and saffron, & sea-
#Text= son it with pepper, salt, & a litle mace,
#Text= then lay it in your coffin, with sweete But-
#Text= ter and the liquor it was seasoned in, and
#Text= so bake it.
#Text=To bake a Mallard.
#Text=Take three or foure Onyons, and stampe
#Text= them in a morter, then straine them with
#Text= a saucer full of vergice, then take your mal-
#Text= lard and put him into the iuyce of the sayde
#Text= Onyons, and season him with pepper, and
#Text= salte, cloues and mace, then put your Mal-
#Text= lard into the coffin with the saide iuyce of
#Text= the onyons, and a good quantity of Winter-
#Text= sauorye, a little tyme, and perselye chopped
#Text= small, and sweete Butter, so close it vp and
#Text= bake it.
#Text=To make a Pye of Humbles.
#Text=Take your humbles being perboiled, and
#Text= choppe them verye small with a good
#Text= quantitye of Mutton sewet, and halfe a
#Text= handfull of hearbes folowing, thime, marga-
#Text= rom, borage, perseley, and a little rosemary,
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= [f14v]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= and season the same being chopped, with
#Text= pepper, cloues and mace, and so close your
#Text= pye and bake him.
#Text=To bake a Red deare.
#Text=Take a handfull of Time, and a handfull
#Text= of rosemarye, a handfull of winter saue-
#Text= rye, a handful of Bay leaues, and a handful
#Text= of fennel, and when your liquor seethe that
#Text= you perboyle your Venison in, put in your
#Text= hearbes also, and perboyle your venison vn-
#Text= till it be halfe enough, then take it out and
#Text= lay it vpon a faire boorde that the water
#Text= may runne out from it, then take a knife
#Text= and pricke it full of holes, and while it is
#Text=warme, haue a faire Traye with vineger
#Text= therein, and so put your Venison therein
#Text= from morning vntill night, and euer now,
#Text= and then turne it vpside downe, and then at
#Text= night haue your coffin ready, and this done
#Text= season it with synamon, ginger, and Nut-
#Text= megges, Pepper and salte, and when you
#Text= haue seasoned it, put it into your coffin, and
#Text= put a good quantity of sweete Butter into
#Text= it, and then put it into the Ouen at hight,
#Text= when you goe to bedde, and in the mor-
#Text= ning draw it forth, and put in a saucer full
#Text= of vineger into your Pye, at a hole aboue
#Text= in the toppe of it, so that the vineger may
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= [f15r]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= runne into eueryplace of it, and then stop
#Text=the hole againe, and turne the bottome vp-
#Text= ward, and so serue it in.
#Text=An other bakemeate for
#Text= Chickins.
#Text=Firste season your Chickins with Su-
#Text= ger, sinamon and ginger, and so lay them
#Text= in your pye, then put in vpon them Goosebe-
#Text= ries, or grapes, or Barberies, then put in
#Text= some sweete Butter and close them vp, and
#Text= when they be almost baked, then put in a
#Text= Cawdle made with hard egges and white
#Text= wine, and serue it.
#Text=To bake Calues feete.
#Text=Take calues feete and boyle them, and
#Text= choppe them fine, and a pounde of white,
#Text= and chop it with them, then chop an onion
#Text= small and put it in them, then take Prunes,
#Text= dates and currans, and put to them, sea-
#Text=Boyle your Rice, and out in the yolkes
#Text= of two or three Egges into the Rice,
#Text= and when it is boyled, put it into a dish, and
#Text= season it with Suger, Sinamon, and Gin-
#Text= ger, and butter, and the iuyce of two or three
#Text= Orenges, and set it on the fire againe.
#Text=To make a Custard.
#Text=Breake your Egges into a bowle, and
#Text= put your Creame into another bowle,
#Text= and straine your egges into the creame, and
#Text= put in saffron, Cloues and mace, and a little
#Text= synamon and ginger, and if you will some
#Text= Suger and butter, and season it with salte,
#Text= and melte your butter, and stirre it with the
#Text= Ladle a good while, and dubbe your custard
#Text= with dates or currans.
#Text=To make a Tarte of Wardens.
#Text=You must bake your Wardens first in a
#Text=Pie, and then take all the wardens and
#Text= cut them in foure quarters, and coare them,
#Text= and put them into a Tarte pinched, with
#Text= your Suger, and season them with Suger,
#Text= Synamon and Ginger, and set them  in
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= [f18r]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= the Ouen, and put no couer on them, but
#Text= you must cutte a couer and laye in the Tart
#Text= when it is baked, and butter the Tarte and
#Text= the couer too, and endore it with suger.
#Text=To make a tarte with butter
#Text= and egges.
#Text=Breake your egges and take the yolkes
#Text= of them, and take butter and melte it,
#Text= let it bee verie hot readie to boyle, and put
#Text=tour butter into your egges, and so straine
#Text= them into a bowle and season them with su-
#Text= ger.
#Text=To make a tarte of
#Text= Spennedge.
#Text=Boyle your Egges and your Creame
#Text= togither, and then put them into a bowle,
#Text= and then boyle your Spinnedge, and when
#Text= they are boyled, take them out of the water
#Text= and straine them into your stuffe before you
#Text= straine your Creame, boyle your stuffe and
#Text= then strain them al againe, and season them
#Text= with suger and salt.
#Text=To make a tarte of
#Text= Strawberries.
#Text=Wash your strawberries, and put them
#Text= into your Tarte, and season them
#Text= with suger, cynamon and Ginger, and put
#Text=in a little red wine into them.
#Text=[f18v]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= To make a Tarte of
#Text= hippes.
#Text=Take Hippes and cutte them, and take the
#Text= seedes out, and wash them verye cleane,
#Text= and put them into your Tarte, and season
#Text= them with suger, cinamon and ginger.
#Text=So you must preserue them with suger,
#Text= Cinamon and Ginger, and put them into a
#Text= gelly pot close.
#Text=To bake the Humbles of a
#Text= Deere.
#Text=Mince them verie small, and season
#Text=them with pepper, Cinamon and
#Text= Ginger, and suger if you will, and Cloues
#Text= and mace, and dates and currants, and if you
#Text= will, mince Almondes and put vnto them,
#Text= and when it is baked, you must put in fine
#Text= fat, and put in suger, cinamon and Ginger,
#Text= and let it boile, and when it is minced, put
#Text= them together.
#Text=To make a veale pie.
#Text=Let your Veale boyle a good while, and
#Text= when it is boyled, mince it by it selfe,
#Text= and the white, by it selfe, and season it with
#Text= salt and pepper, cinamon and ginger, and
#Text= suger, and cloues and mace, and you muste
#Text= haue prunes and raisons, dates & currantes
#Text= on the top.
#Text=[f19r]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= For to make mutton pies.
#Text=Mince your Mutton and your white to-
#Text= gether, and when it is minced, season it
#Text= with pepper, cinamon & ginger, and Cloues
#Text= and mace, and prunes, currants and dates,
#Text= and reasons and harde egges boyled & chop-
#Text= ped verie small, and throw them on the top.
#Text=To bake calues feete.
#Text=Season them with salte & pepper, and but-
#Text= ter, and Currantes if you will, and when
#Text= they bee baked put in a little white Wine
#Text= and suger, or vineger and suger, or vergice
#Text= and suger.
#Text=To bake Chickins in a
#Text= Cawdle.
#Text=Season them with salt and pepper, and
#Text=put in butter, and so let them bake, and
#Text= when they be baked, boile a fewe bar-
#Text= beries and pruines, and currants and take
#Text= a litle white wine or vergice, and let it boile
#Text= and put in a little suger, and set it on the fire
#Text= a little, and straine in two or three yolkes of
#Text= egges into the wine, and when you take the
#Text= dish of the fire, put the pruines and cur-
#Text= rants and barberies into the dish, and then
#Text= put them in altoheather into the pye of chic-
#Text= kins.
#Text=[f19v]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= To bake pigeons.
#Text=Season them with Pepper and Salt and
#Text= butter.
#Text=To bake a Conie.
#Text=Season him with Pepper and Salt, and
#Text= put in butter and currantes, and when
#Text= it is baked, put in a little vergice and suger
#Text= into the pie, and serue it vp.
#Text=To bake a Gammon of bacon
#Text= to keepe colde.
#Text=You must first boyle him a quarter of an
#Text= houre before you stuffe him, and stuffe
#Text= him with sweete hearbes, and harde Egges
#Text= chopped together, or parselie.
#Text=To bake a Fillet of beefe to
#Text= keepe colde.
#Text=Mince him very small, and seeth him
#Text= with pepper and salt, and make hym
#Text= vp togeather accordingly, and put them in
#Text= your pie, and larde him verie thicke.
#Text=To make fine bread.
#Text=Take halfe a pound of fine suger well
#Text= beaten, and as much Flower, and put
#Text= thereto foure Egges whites, and being ve-
#Text= ry well beaten, you must mingle them with
#Text= anniseedes bruised, and beeing all beaten
#Text= togither, put into your moulde, melting the
#Text= sauce ouer first with a lyttle butter, and set
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= [f20r]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= it in the Ouen, and turne it twice or thrice
#Text= in the baking.
#Text=To bake a Neates tongue.
#Text=First pouder the tongue three or foure
#Text= dayes, and then seeth it in faire water,
#Text= then blanche it and Larde it and season it
#Text=the Sunne picke out the stones, and seeth
#Text= them with the chickins, and when it is wel
#Text= sodden, season it with a little salt and strain
#Text= it and so serue it.
#Text=To make another very good po-
#Text= tage to bee vsed in the
#Text= morning.
#Text=Take a chickin and seeth it in faire water
#Text= and put to it violet leaues a handfull or
#Text= twoo, or else some other good hearbes, that
#Text= you like in the stead of them, and so let them
#Text= seeth togeather tyll the chicken be readie to
#Text= fall a peeces, then straine it, and cut thinne
#Text= peeces of bread, and seeth in it till the bread
#Text= be verie tender, and then season it with salt.
#Text=And on the fishe daie seeth the hearbes as
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= [f28r]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= before in faire running water and straine it
#Text= and seeth bread as before in it, and season it
#Text= with salt and put in a peece of butter.
#Text=To boile diuers kindes of
#Text= fishes.
#Text=Bret, Conger, Thornebacke, plaice, fresh
#Text= Samon, all these you must boyle with a
#Text= litle faire water and vineger, a litle salt, and
#Text= bay leaues, and sauce them in vineger, and
#Text= a little of the broth that they are sodden in
#Text= with a little salt, and as you see cause shift
#Text= your sauce, as you do beefe in brine, and al-
#Text= so fresh Sturgion, seeth it as is aforsayde,
#Text= and sauce it as yee did the other, and so yee
#Text= may keepe it halfe a yeare with chaunging
#Text= of the sauce, and salte Sturgion seeth it in
#Text= water & salt, and a litle vineger, and let it be
#Text=them then like peasecods, and when ye will
#Text= serue them, frye them in Oyle in a frying
#Text= panne, but let the Oyle bee verie hotte, and
#Text= the fire soft for burning of them, and when
#Text= yee make them for fleshe dayes, take a
#Text= fillet of veale and mince it fine, and put the
#Text= yolkes of two or three rawe egges to it, and
#Text= season it with pepper, salt, cloues, mace, ho-
#Text= nie, suger, cinamon, ginger, small raisons,
#Text= or great minced, and for your paste, butter,
#Text= the yolke of an egge, and season them, and
#Text= frye them in butter as yee did the other in
#Text= oyle.
#Text=[f30r]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= To bake Quinces, Peares and
#Text= Wardens.
#Text=stampe it and straine it with two or three
#Text= yolkes of egges, and then set it on a chafin-
#Text= dish of coales, and season it with butter and
#Text= Suger, and when the paste is hardened in
#Text= the Ouen, put in this Comode, strake it
#Text= euen.
#Text=[f30v]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= To make blame mangle.
#Text=Take all the braine of a capon and stamp
#Text= it in a morter fine, and blanched al-
#Text= mondes, and sometimes put to them Rose-
#Text= water, and season it with pouder of syna-
#Text= mon, ginger. and suger, and so serue it,
#Text=
#Text= To make a Tarte of an eare
#Text= of Veale.
#Text=Take two pound of great Raisons, and
#Text= washe them cleane, and pick them, and
#Text= take out the stones of them, and take two
#Text= Kidneyes of Veale, and a peece of the legge
#Text= which is leane, and boyle them altogether
#Text= in a pot with the straint of the broth of mut-
#Text= ton, and boyle it, and let it boyle the space of
#Text= one howre, then take it vp and choppe it
#Text= fine, and temper it with crummes of bread
#Text= finely grated, ant take nine yolks of egs, &
#Text= temper them altogether, and season them with
#Text= sinamon, ginger, suger, and small Raisins,
#Text= great raisons minced, Dates and Saffron.
#Text=Then take fine flowre and water, and three
#Text= yolkes of Egges, Butter and saffron, and
#Text= make them like a round Tart close with a
#Text= couer of the same paste, and set him in the
#Text= Ouen, and let him stand one howre, then
#Text= take him forth, and endore it with Butter
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= [f31r]
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= and cast a powder of synamon, Ginger, and
#Text= suger, and so serue it.
#Text=To make Tarte of Straw-
#Text= beries.
#Text=Take Strawberies and washe them in
#Text= claret wine, thicke and temper them
#Text= with rosewater, and season them with
#Text= sinamon, suger and ginger, and spread it on
#Text= the Tarte, and endore the sides with butter,
#Text= and cast on Suger and biskettes, and serue
#Text= them so.
#Text=To make a close Tarte of Cherries.
#Text=Take out the stones, and laye them as
#Text= whole as you can in a Charger, and
#Text=put Mustard in, synamon and ginger
#Text= to them, and laye them in a Tarte whole,
#Text= and close them, and let them stand three quar-
#Text= ters of an houre in the Ouen, then take a
#Text= sirrope of Muskadine, and damask water
#Text= and suger, and serue it.
#Text=To make a close Tart of greene Pease.
#Text=Take halfe a peck of greene Pease, sheale
#Text= them and seeth them, and cast them into
#Text= a cullender, and let the water go from them
#Text= then put them into the Tart whole, & season
#Text= them with Pepper, saffron and salte, and a
#Text= dishe of sweet butter, close and bake him al-
#Text= most one houre, then drawe him, and put to
#Text=
#Text=
#Text= [f31v]
